body: Hello everyone, Has anyone run the daylighting and thermal simulation for expanded metal mesh? What I am using for my current project is called "Okalux" which looks like [this](https://arch5541.files.wordpress.com/2012/09/des-moines-public-library_2-2.jpg). As you can see, it has a 3d shape which can function as shading devices - not like a flat punching metal panel.  [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/-M5JLAFxn1FVV4lRprxpShfnA8XHmbBlgdEq22mdHZPyNEIMioAoZ3KE-UPgOjxsbiPb*zoKbfI1ao-LJsfRzx15FJf7fxAX/Picture1.png) Basically what I would like to try is to check the DF/Illuminance and the solar gain before/after installing the expanded metal (there are several iterations), so I could use the output to optimize the density of the metal mesh. I am wondering if Ladybug+honeybee can support daylighting analysis using this components and also thermal analysis to check the solar gain. If anyone can give any instruction or advice, that would be very much appreciated! I am attaching the product brochure for your information: [i_okatech_e.pdf](http://api.ning.com:80/files/-M5JLAFxn1FKMRmp*Rz44bUSXXBt5tGkoYXOJf7TLm6CE6VCBTX8XA0Nb4MRMla1YR*GsOvoF8UJnwtL-NdZqomLBZEfQ*6t/i_okatech_e.pdf) Look forward to hearing from you all! Thanks, So
